entry.title: Re: Data migration from SAP C4C to ZOHO CRM system
entry.content:
Hello, 

With Migration let me assume you want to move a huge amount of data from Source(SAP C4C in this case) system to Target(ZOHO Crm) System,

If Yes,

Then this is something which you need to check at the Target end i.e. ZOHO Crm system, what kind of tools ZOHO Crm has provisioned for Data Migration. It's the same way we have Data Migration Cockpit at SAP End.

Now if the ask is just to push Transactional data in a real-time basis from SAP C4C to ZOHO CRM then you need to consume the APIs provided by ZOHO CRM inside SAP System, am sure they would be having a vast Portfolio of Standard REST and SOAP based APIs for various Transactions just the same way SAP has.

Thanks,

Sijin

entry.title: Poor Performance in RAP Managed Scenario with INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE
entry.content:
Hi developers,

we encountered a performance issue in a managed RAP scenario. In our usecase a large set of around 100.000 records with 19 columns is updated through a RAP action. Only 3 of the 19 columns are changed during the action and we mark these columns in the %control structure for each record. Our system is onpremise S/4HANA 2023.

We noticed that the update to the database takes over 2 minutes. We traced the db access. RAP utilizes the class CL_CSP_SQL_ACCESS to write the data to the database. The UPDATE statement uses the addition INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control.

The generated SQL statement send to the database looks like this:

UPDATE "DBTAB"
SET
"COLUMN1" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN1" END,
"COLUMN2" = CASE ? WHEN 1 THEN ? ELSE "COLUMN2" END,
...
WHERE "CLIENT" ...

 The whole statement is divided into smaller packages.  The execution time is around 160 seconds for all packages.

As a workaround we set our entity to with unmanaged save with full data. Then we implemented the UPDATE ourself in the save_modified method:

IF update-entity IS NO INITIAL.
  UPDATE dbtab FROM TABLE @update-entity MAPPING FROM ENTITY.
ENDIF.

 The execution time is now around 1 second for the whole UPDATE statement. The with full data addition costs another 1-2 seconds for reading the missing data.

We also tried unmanaged save without with full data and with added INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE %control which confirmed the poor performance of managed save.

There is another topic to this performance issue and a blog post about the INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE, but both are closed:

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/performance-implications-of-using-quot-set-indicators-quot/td-p/12660187 

https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-blog-posts/abap-sql-indicator-structures/ba-p/13496401

@ SAP: Are there any plans to improve performance of INDICATORS SET STRUCTURE or the managed database access?

@ community: has anybody noticed the same behaviour or any suggestions how to avoid this?

best regards
Christian

entry.title: New BTP Trial Account: 'Forbidden' Error in SAP Build & 'Destination Service' Creation Fails
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I recently had a widespread "Establish Trust" issue that was resolved by the SAP team. Following that, I have created a completely new BTP trial account to start fresh.

On this brand-new account, I have successfully subscribed to SAP Build and assigned all the necessary role collections. I can successfully access the SAP Build Lobby.

However, the account is still not functional. When I click "Create" after reviewing, to make a new application inside the SAP Build Lobby, I receive a "Forbidden" error.

  • (Correlation Id: a108cc8a-b036-4676-7049-e37deac6ec9b)

The recommended solution was to subscribe to the Destination Service (lite plan). When I attempt this, the service instance creation fails every time with the error: "Couldn't create service instance 'destination-instance'." (Screenshot of this error is attached).

This indicates that even this brand-new trial account is not being provisioned correctly on the backend, preventing essential services from being created and blocking all development.

Could the SAP team please investigate the provisioning status of my new trial account? Thank you for your help.

on clicking create after review for new apps creation

on clicking create after review

entry.title: Operators available in Regular Expressions (RegEx) in ABSL - hexadecimal values
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have a requirement to validate certain text fields by checking whether they contain any non-UTF-8 characters. For this purpose, we would like to use the built-in .FindRegex function for strings in ABSL. 

However, to achieve this, we need to reference the allowed characters by their hexadecimal values. Normally, this is done using escape tokens such as as \x or \u. For example, the following RegEx works correctly in standard implementations (see www.regex101.comüòû

[^\x{0000}-\x{c5be}]

Unfortunately, this expression does not seem to be interpreted correctly by ABSL. It appears that ABSL can interpret escape tokens to some extent ‚Äî for instance, the following RegEx works as expected:

[^\\x00-\\x99]

(The first backslash escapes the second one so that ABSL interprets it correctly.)

However, this pattern is limited to single-byte values only (from 00 fo FF) and we need to include all UTF-8 characters, which requires two-byte tokens such as the one in the earlier example.

I'm seeking general technical background information about the RegEx flavour used in C4C. Specifically, if it is based on PCRE2, because then it should support both \x63 and \x{0063} syntaxes. However, only the former seems to be recognized, which suggests either a different underlying standard is being used or there is an explicit limitation in functionality.

Could you please provide documentation or guidance on which operators are supported in ABSL for use in the .FindRegEx function?

Thank you and best regards,
Marek

entry.title: Re: Does version management for purchase contract require...
entry.content:
SAP Note 3252885 clarifies that version management is not fully integrated with flexible workflow or Fiori apps like F1600A. Even if versions are created in the backend, the Fiori UI does not display them. This is not a configuration error ‚Äî it‚Äôs a functional gap in the app.

SAP documentation says: ‚ÄúEnsure flexible workflow is activated before enabling versioning.‚Äù  Version Management in Purchase Contracts  This means you must activate flexible workflow for contracts. But even with workflow active, version history may not appear in the app UI.

Go to ME33K or ME3N to view version history. Backend versioning works reliably here.

With CDS view I_PurchaseContractVersion, build a Fiori Elements app or embedded analytics report to expose version data.

entry.title: Re: Assign Processes to Process responsibles in Signavio...
entry.content: Hello Angeliki, this use case is quite rare, as entries are typically expected to be mutually exclusive.‚Ä®However, there are two possible ways to achieve what you described: Option 1:‚Ä®You want to display the people who share the same role title within a single dictionary entry.‚Ä®Please note that in this setup, the role will appear in the process model together with all associated names - meaning you would not be linking to a specific person, but to the role itself.‚Ä®To implement this, you can create a custom attribute for the dictionary entries:‚Ä®Navigate to Process Manager Settings ‚Üí Define Notations & Attributes ‚Üí Dictionary, select the relevant dictionary category, and click ‚ÄúAdd‚Äù next to Custom Attribute to create a new one. Option 2:‚Ä®You create the same role multiple times, each time adding a short identifier or abbreviation.‚Ä®This way, the process model will show exactly which person is associated with the specific role.

entry.title: SAP BODS 4.3 Upgrade Issues
entry.content:
We have a upgraded SAP BODS from 4.2 version to SAP BODS 4.3 Version. The Upgrade is happening in new App servers and SQL Servers from the old servers. That is on perm to azure. All firewalls are open

Steps we took for migration

  1. Remove the job server association in SAP 4.2 (old environment) before taking a copy and
    set up the association again after.
  2. Backup the repo database
  3. Restore in new SQL server
  4. Upgrade the repo via repo manager
  5. Register the repo in server manager and CMS and given user required permissions

Now I am getting the error while opening the repo. I feel like some of the metadata in repo table are sitting with old authentications and it is not allowing to open the repo. When I am creating the new repo it is all working fine without any issues. I am able to connect to it finely Error I am getting connecting to repo.

entry.title: Material Documents Overview (F1077): Enhancing Features and Usability
entry.content:
Hello SAP users! Let's talk about some updates to the Material Documents Overview app (F1077) and new features designed to close the gaps between the older WebGUI application MB51 and the newer app. We want to thank everyone who shared their experience with the app‚Äîit really helps us make things better for you. The following updates are only relevant for the S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. 

Closing Functional Gaps and Enhancing User Experience

SAP is not only working on closing the gaps between MB51 and the Material Documents Overview app but is also enhancing the user experience. The new app is designed to offer a smoother, more intuitive experience that makes it worthwhile to switch. Keep in mind that transitioning to this new app is essential, as the old app will eventually be deprecated.

FAQs Based on Your Feedback

We've gathered some frequently asked questions from customer feedback and are happy to answer them here:

Q: How can I add and arrange more columns and filter options?

A: Click the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù icon at the top of the list report table. Under ‚ÄúColumns,‚Äù enter your search term, like ‚Äúspecial stock type.‚Äù Check the boxes for the columns you want to add, then click ‚ÄúOK.‚Äù You can drag and drop to arrange columns as you like.

Q: How can I sort the list report?

A: Click the ‚ÄúSettings‚Äù icon at the top of the list report table. Then click ‚ÄúSort‚Äù and pick how you want to sort the data, like by Plant, Storage Location, Material, or Batch. You can save your changes as a variant under "My views," and share it with others if you want.

Q: How can I see values such as Value in local Currency or the Signed quantity?

A: You either select the variant Material Document List with Values or click on setting and add the filter Value in local Currency and or Signed Quantity.

Q: How can I find or create a variant?

A: Select the dropdown menu for ‚ÄúSelect View‚Äù in the top left corner next to the Standard view ‚Äì choose a predelivered variant to see a different set of fields e. g. ‚ÄúMaterial Document List with Values‚Äù.

To create your own variant, add the filters that you want to the list view by clicking on the settings icon for the table. Select your filters and choose OK. If you want, you can also change the sequence of the columns by dragging and dropping them into place. When you have the columns arranged how you wish, click on the dropdown menu arrow for 'Select View' next to Standard and select Save As. Give your variant view a name and choose Save.

Q: Where can I find the Document Header Text or Reference field?

The Document Header Text field can be selected via the settings. The Reference field is called Delivery Note in the new app, and you can also find it via the settings. Both fields are available on the material document's detail page under the "General Information" section.

Q: Where can I see the complete set of information for a stock transfer including the issuing and receiving party?

A: In your filter bar, select filter "Include Auto-Created Item (Transfer)" and set it to "yes". You will then see two line entries. Alternatively, you can display all transfer related attributes in one line by selecting the according fields labelled with ‚Äútransfer‚Äù in the settings menu.

Q: How can I separate material code and description in Excel downloads?

A: Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù icon and choose ‚ÄúExport as.‚Äù Then select your format and destination. Make sure to check the ‚ÄúSplit cells with multiple values‚Äù box before you click ‚ÄúExport.‚Äù Your Excel file will then have separate columns for material descriptions and codes.

Wrap-Up

We‚Äôre focused on not only making the Material Documents Overview app better by addressing functional gaps but also improving the overall user experience. Your input is really important in helping us improve, and making the switch to the new app will ensure you're ready for when the old app is phased out.

Keep an eye on the official roadmap for more updates, and let us know your thoughts in the comments. Feel free to reach out with any questions. Thanks for being a part of this journey!

References:

Interested in more information on Inventory Management? Check out the following resource https://www.sap-press.com/inventory-management-with-sap-s4hana_6141/

entry.title: Determining freight costs in the STO transfer process
entry.content: I need help with the customer's request below. "The shipping cost must be included in the product cost, so it should be accounted for in the material inventory account. When shipping is for two different materials, the shipping cost should be prorated to the corresponding material account. And the STO shipping cost should be considered at the destination unit."

entry.title: Devtoberfest 2025 - What is Happening in Week 3
entry.content:
Hi everybody, the second week of Devtoberfest is almost over and we are heading into Week 3. This blog post should give you a good overview on what is happening in our third week of Devtoberfest.

Sessions for Week 3 (Oct 13 - Oct 17):

All sessions for Week 3 can be found in our Session Catalogue: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events

üü¢ ABAP (Monday)

  • What's new in RAP
  • ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse ‚Äì What's new
  • Evolving data integration with SQL services and CDS external entities
  • Discover the Latest Innovations in the ABAP Language

üü£ Tooling & Frontend (Tuesday)

  • Generate Process Artifacts by Importing BPMN Models from Any Process Design Tool
  • Roles and Authorization in SAP Build Process Automation: A Developer‚Äôs Guide
  • Supercharge SAP Build Process Automation with the UiPath Foundation Add-On
  • UI5 Middleware FE Mockserver in Practice ‚Äî Setup, Use Cases, Live Coding
  • Extend Fiori UIs in SAP Build: Empowering Adaptation Projects with Generative AI Capabilities
  • Use GenAI in Process Automation to Adapt 100s of Templates to Your Needs

üî¥Integration (Wednesday)

  • Using Intermediate Message Events and Success Factors Events in SAP Build Process Automation
  • Seamless Side-By-Side Extensibility with SAP Build and SAP Cloud Application Event Hub
  • SAP Cloud ALM - Integration & Exception Monitoring for SAP Integration Suite
  • Partner Directory Accelerator Tool for Pipeline Concept - an SAP Open-Source Project

üîµData & AI (Thursday)

  • Bottom Line - Teaching Neural Networks with Snap!
  • Modernize your SAP Business Warehouse with SAP Business Data Cloud
  • Manage and Optimize Prompts in SAP AI Core: Concepts and Application
  • What‚Äôs new in AI Core Orchestration
  • SAP Data Products: how to handle them today and what is the plan for tomorrow?
  • Accelerate SAP CAP and Fiori Development with AI Tools
  • Behind the Magic: How Cirque du Soleil Reimagined Invoice Management with SAP Business AI

üü† CAP (Friday)

  • CAP Tools ‚Äì What's New and Hot
  • Best Practices in CAP
  • Testing SAP CAP Node.js apps with cds.test
  • SAP HANA Application Migration Assistant - Transforming with Gen AI

üü° Community (Friday)

  • How to Interview for an SAP Tech Job

Fun Activities - The SAP Puzzles

In week 3, we are launching the new and challenging SAP Puzzles! Head over to the Tutorial Navigator to solve the puzzles and earn points.

Here are links to the Puzzles:

  • üü° Devtoberfest 2025 - Coder's Challenge - ABAP Cloud
  • üü° Devtoberfest 2025 - Coder's Challenge - CAP Documentation (Capire!)
  • üü° Devtoberfest 2025 - Coder's Challenge - SAP Build

Validation of your session participation

At Devtoberfest, almost every activity earns you points against the Grand Prize in our competition. This is the case for your participation in the Devtoberfest sessions for each week. Every week we release validation tutorials for the different topic tracks ABAP, Tooling & Frontend, Integration, Data & AI, CAP, and the Community sessions. The validation tutorials can be found in our Tutorial Navigator. 

Be advised that assignment of Badges and Points take some time as we are batch processing these in a given interval.

Head over to our tutorial page and complete the validation tutorials for earning your points!

List of all point earning activities

entry.title: Re: MB5B - DIfference in the Storage Location stock and Valuated Stock (opening and closing quantity
entry.content: Please any one with a solution

entry.title: Re: Document Grounding in SAP AI Core: RAG with AWS S3 via Object Store Service on SAP BTP
entry.content:
Hi @Joni,

We are planning to store our documents either in SharePoint or SAP Document Management (SDM). I have a few questions regarding how document grounding behaves in such setups:

  1. Suppose we currently have four documents on which the grounding pipeline has already run. If a fifth document is later added, does the grounding process run again on all existing documents, or only on the newly added document?

  2. When documents are stored in an AWS bucket via SDM (SAP Document Management Service), is it correct that ‚Äî as of now ‚Äî there is no selective grounding mechanism available, and the grounding process applies to all documents within that repository or bucket?

  3. Is the ‚Äúgeneric secret‚Äù configuration different from creating a destination and running the pipeline endpoint using that destination name? If so, could you please clarify the relationship or distinction between these two approaches

entry.title: Re: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable i...
entry.content:
Please check the product type you have used for the Product you are creating procurement data for and then check for the work departments supported for the product type you use in for your product. Make sure Purchasing is applicable for the product type of the product you want to extend to.
You can check the Define Attributes of Material Types SSCUI to check the relevance of the work/user departments of the product type.

entry.title: Re: Valuehelp for Migration
entry.content:
Hello @Simon_Lehnert 

For Product migration in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, enter ISO codes (per UN/CEFACT) in the ‚ÄúBase Unit (ISO Format)‚Äù column‚Äîuse C62 for piece, KGM for kg, LTR for litre, MTR for meter, and HUR for hour, not SAP unit keys.

Templates need ISO codes instead of SAP UoM keys. SAP‚Äôs BH5 guide states migration objects ‚Äúuse ISO codes for UoM values,‚Äù so map to valid ISO codes during Convert Values / Value Mapping. SAP Press Data Migration To SAP S/4HANA From File (BH5)

Migration Cockpit treats UoM strictly according to ISO. SAP KBA 2907822 confirms UoM handling in the cockpit and typical mapping issues when ISO isn‚Äôt provided/linked. SAP Support Portal-2907822 - SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Unit of Measurement (UOM) Handling: Using ISO codes

Get the authoritative list from your tenant by pulling your configuration, as SAP provides standard units and ISO codes, and you maintain customer-specific ones. This is the source the system validates against.  SAP Help Portal-Developer Extensibility-Units of Measurement

Examples (cross-checked with UNECE Rec. 20): ‚Äúpiece/one‚Äù is C62; litre LTR; kilogram KGM; meter MTR; hour HUR‚Äîthese are UN/CEFACT common codes used by SAP. Unece:UnitMeasureCode

What to do (accurate and tenant-safe)

Migration Cockpit ‚Üí Value Mapping (Product object):

Review/maintain internal UoM ‚Üî ISO assignments in your tenant for migration reference.

If codes seem missing in the mapping task, consult KBA 3588262 (UoM missing on mapping task). SAP Support Portal

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: ü§¨ SAP Public Cloud: It's not a Bug, it's a feature n...
entry.content:
I can see how the responses are frustrating - I can't disagree with you on that. I know scope items have a localized or not list, but i don't think that exists for API's, so if it's not anywhere in the country documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0864cb07010642b3bde45a20de4975bc/f938dc575f29c024e10000000a44147b.html
I'm not sure if it's listed.

One comment I wanted to add though is regarding the influence portal - API type requests are somewhat fast-tracked through the customer influence portal. They don't have the same minimum voting threshold as e.g. some other LoB core functionality type so it may be worth considering attempting that approach even if you've found it more difficult/slow for non-API type requests.

entry.title: WHT tax issue in Vendor Invoice Posting
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

The scenario is that after completing the PO and MIGO steps, the system automatically parks the invoice document with the help of a custom program, and it is subsequently posted via MIR6. Currently, the vendor master data has multiple Withholding Tax (WHT) Types/Codes maintained. We require a solution where the invoice document displays only the single, mandatory WHT Code and deletes any others. Since there are multiple documents, performing this manually every time is complicated. Please suggest a solution for this, even if it requires a custom solution.

entry.title: Re: AI answers to SAP questions
entry.content:
Hi @greg_not_so, we published new AI guidelines for the SAP Community yesterday. 

The Digital Services Act is an EU law, that all European companies need to comply with:
"The DSA regulates online intermediaries and platforms such as marketplaces, social networks, content-sharing platforms, app stores, and online travel and accommodation platforms. Its main goal is to prevent illegal and harmful activities online and the spread of disinformation. It ensures user safety, protects fundamental rights, and creates a fair and open online platform environment."

entry.title: Release Highlights of advanced Available-To-Promise (aATP) in SAP Cloud ERP, Private Edition 2025
entry.content:
Order Promising plays a pivotal role in connecting supply chain planning‚Äîdriven by SAP Integrated Business Planning‚Äîwith execution in SAP Cloud ERP, across the order-to-cash process. Advanced ATP (aATP) in SAP ERP Private Cloud remains the flagship solution, delivering real-time, constraint-based order confirmations that enhance supply chain performance and ensure reliable customer commitments.

Figure 1 : Key functionalities of advanced ATP

With the 2025 FPS0 release, SAP has addressed several highly requested customer requirements for advanced ATP. Key enhancements in this release include consolidation of shipping locations during Alternative-Based Confirmation, package size consideration in availability checks, greater flexibility for manual confirmation adjustments, length-based ATP for the cable industry, and characteristics evaluation during availability checks‚Äîdelivering critical capabilities to support complex business needs.

Let‚Äôs do a deep dive into some of the key capabilities.

Consolidation of Shipping Locations

When customers order products available in partial quantities across multiple distribution centers or stock-holding locations, Alternative-Based Confirmation(ABC) now enables consolidation into a single location through automated creation of internal stock transport orders, ensuring one streamlined shipment instead of multiple ones.

Figure 2: Distributed fulfilment with Alternative-Based Confirmation (ABC)

Figure 3: Consolidated fulfilment with ABC with automated creation of Stock Transport Orders (STO)

This is especially valuable in export processes, where goods must be consolidated at the most suitable location for tariff, tax declaration, or letter-of-credit handling. The process reduces manual effort in creating stock transport documents, improves delivery date accuracy, and enhances compliance with export regulations. By optimizing logistics, it minimizes complexity, enhances customer satisfaction, and ensures efficient, legally compliant global shipping operations.

You can enable the automated creation of STOs during the process of Alternative Based Confirmation in ABC strategy.

Figure 4 ‚Äì Alternative-Based Confirmation with Stock Transport Document Creation

Unrestricted checks in Interactive Backorder Processing

Interactive Backorder Processing (IBOP) enables order fulfillment managers to adjust confirmations in real time based on business priorities. During unplanned supply shortages, scheduled Backorder Processing runs may be too late to resolve issues. IBOP provides flexibility to manually redistribute or modify confirmations for selected requirements, ensuring critical demands are met. The tool offers contextual information to support informed decision-making. Order fulfillment managers can also override constraints such as Product Allocation and Supply Protection in exceptional cases, addressing escalated business needs. This capability is invaluable during supply chain disruptions, empowering managers to respond quickly, reduce delays, and maintain customer satisfaction. 

Figure 5 ‚Äì Interactive Backorder Processing with Unrestricted checks

Order confirmation based on packaging size

Many businesses sell products in predefined package sizes, such as cartons of 24 cans or boxes of 20 packs. The enhanced availability check feature helps align orders with these packaging rules by automatically rounding requested quantities to the nearest valid unit, like full pallets, pallet layers, or cases, based on set rounding profiles, and rounding down confirmed quantities to meet packaging and transportation constraints. Business Add-In can also be used to incorporate custom rounding logic.

Figure 6 ‚Äì Rounding in aATP

This approach makes order quantities realistic from the start, reducing the need for manual corrections or late changes. The result is improved process efficiency, smoother execution, fewer errors, and enhanced customer satisfaction through reliable and accurate deliveries.

Characteristics Evaluation in Supply creation-Based Confirmation

Supply creation-Based Confirmation (SBC) integrates aATP with PP/DS to confirm sales orders by triggering production when supply is insufficient, considering both finite capacity and component availability. The latest release also incorporates CDP characteristics during confirmation‚Äîcrucial for mill industries that plan, and produce based on product attributes and rely on block planning over production resources.

Length based Availability Check

Cable industries often sell products based on length, making precise availability checks critical. The Length-Based Availability Check in Supply creation-Based Confirmation (SBC) ensures that a single coil contains the required minimum length to meet an order. For example, if a customer needs a 1000m steel cable, the system only confirms it if a coil of at least 1000m is available‚Äîsmaller coils adding up to 1000m cannot be used. Once validated, ATP can trigger a cutting order, or in case of shortages, initiate production. This capability helps industries match customer requirements exactly, avoid unusable inventory, integrate tightly with production, and ensure reliable delivery commitments.

Figure 7: Length based ATP with Supply creation-Based Confirmation

That‚Äôs not all. Supply Protection has been enhanced to resolve overprotection and other critical issues causing unexpected results in sales order confirmations. New rating attributes in Alternative-Based Confirmation are added to simplify the maintenance of supersession chains. Enhanced Business Add-Ins provide greater flexibility to meet custom requirements‚Äîallowing modification of substitution results in ABC, insertion or manipulation of requirements, and advanced sorting in Backorder Processing, etc.

These are just a few highlights from the wide range of new enhancements in Order Promising in SAP Cloud ERP Private Edition. With a strong roadmap focused on AI and Analytics, future releases will continue to deliver next-generation capabilities to meet evolving customer needs.

For more information on advanced ATP in SAP Cloud ERP, Private Edition, please get in touch with Sujeet Acharya (sujeet.acharya@sap.com) and Wolfram Schick (wolfram.schick@sap.com)  

Please feel free to share your thoughts or feedback in the comment section.

entry.title: Re: Moderation on SAP Community
entry.content:

I have provided more information on the delete options on this answer: https://community.sap.com/t5/questions-about-sap-websites/why-no-delete-options-for-comments-answers-posts-questions-etc/qaq-p/14215465

Short answer is, yes, for the time being please alert a moderator if you need to delete a comment published by mistake. The whole moderation team also delete content which is clearly published by mistake, as we see it. (of course with permission from the author)

Kind regards,
Anne

entry.title: Read audit report for potential mass breach
entry.content: From an audit team at a client I got the following request: How do we audit the situation that RBP was incorrectly configured opening the system up for all employees potentially seeing data for colleagues that they should not have access to (e.g., see salary information). The read audit report only allows for 10 employees to be checked per run. It is not an option to run the report hundreds or even thousands of times to verify nobody actually accessed data they should not be allowed to see.

entry.title: Re: Consume Odata V2 ord V4 in custom App Fiori deployed...
entry.content:
Hello @peppez88 

Custom Fiori applications deployed on-stack in S/4HANA Public Cloud are permitted to perform CRUD operations exclusively on proprietary custom services, and not on standard API_* services.

You can‚Äôt use standard API_* services in an on-stack custom UI (Public Cloud).
SAP KBA 3445942 states deployment is blocked, citing Note 3424818 for restriction. Use API_* only from BTP side-by-side, not from UI in S/4HANA Cloud. SAP Support Portal-3445942 - UI Development in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Frequently Asked Questions

What you can use for CRUD in an on-stack customised Fiori app:

Key-User path: The Custom Business Object (CBO), along with its generated OData service (service generation can be enabled in the CBO application), is available for custom UIs deployed to the S/4HANA Cloud tenant. SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Business Objects

Developer path (ABAP Cloud/RAP): A RAP business service (OData V4) is available in the development tenant; custom UIs can access this service and be deployed on-stack.SAP Help Portal-Developer Extensibility

If you need to interact with standard business API_BUSINESS_PARTNER or API_PRODUCT_SRV using CRUD operations:

Develop the UI alongside SAP BTP and access the published S/4 APIs using a Destination or Communication Arrangement. According to the FAQ above, this is the approved method. SAP Support Portal-3445942 - UI Development in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Frequently Asked Questions

SAP Useful documentation

Develop a custom UI on CBO service and deploy to S/4HANA Cloud (tutorial). SAP Develop a Custom UI for an SAP S/4HANA Cloud System

Custom Business Objects app (create BO ‚Üí generate service/UI). SAP Help Portal-Custom Business Objects

Developer Extensibility overview (RAP services for on-stack UIs). SAP Help Portal-Developer Extensibility

Chuma Ofole

entry.title: XML field ustrd different
entry.content:
We have run MANAGE AUTOMATIC PAYMENTS app for the same vendor and the system has generated 2 different XML.

How the system populate the tag <Ustrd>?

Thanks,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: XML field ustrd different
entry.content:
Dear customer,

Ustrd is usually fulfilled with the note to payee. If you are using note to payee, on SSCUI 101972 "Set Up Payment Methods for Each Country/Region for Payment Transactions" you can see which note to payee your payment is assigned to Payment Method.

Then, on SSCUI 102655 "Adjust Note to Payee" you can check how the note to payee is being fulfilled.

If you need further information, you can also review this KBA below which explain further the note to payee process and scenario according to your configuration:

  • 0003090392 - Payment advice and note to payee explains the scenarios for note to payee.

For other fields, to understand where a the information is coming from, you can perform a trace as per this blog below:

  • Analyze the Processing of Outgoing Payment Files from Map Format Data

entry.title: Re: SAP BODS 4.3 Upgrade Issues
entry.content:
There are several components that should be checked:

1. ODBC Driver Configuration (DSN):
Ensure that the ODBC (DSN) used to connect to your repository is properly configured (username/password) If it's missing on the BI server, you‚Äôll need to create it.

2. Registered Repository in CMC:
Verify that the repository registered in the Central Management Console (CMC) is active. It will only be active if it's correctly configured with the appropriate username and password.

3. Job Server Configuration:
Review the job server settings in the "Data Services Server Manager". Make sure the connection is properly established and functioning as expected.

.....
Hope this helps!

entry.title: From Hype to Hands-On: Level Up Your AI Skills This October
entry.content:
In the age of AI, the skills we build today will define how we work tomorrow. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre launching a new series of blogs spotlighting the latest AI learning assets and upcoming opportunities.

Are you looking to gain confidence with SAP Business AI through practical learning grounded in product truth? Then don‚Äôt miss our newest AI live session format, which is all about getting productive with SAP Business AI as we go Beyond Hype. These sessions are designed for Joule practitioners and AI Foundation developers moving beyond the POC phase.

Thanks for your curiosity in the first sessions! Let me follow up on your most asked questions:

  1. What are the Joule capabilities that exist today?
    On help.sap.com you‚Äôll see all Joule functions per product area to help you become more productive with Joule. Here are some of the recent examples from SAP SuccessFactors or Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Explain your pay statement in May 2025.
  • Why are my earnings this month and last month different?
  • Show the master output material planned for the quantity of production order 123456.

    Did you know that Joule is releasing new features every other week? Log in with your SAP user ID on SAP Help and subscribe to what‚Äôs new to discover what‚Äôs changed since the last release.

  1.  

  2. How can I activate Joule across SAP cloud products?
    Did you know you can activate Joule across your SAP cloud products for free with Joule Base? It offers some basic features with your SAP cloud subscription and helps you use SAP systems more easily, search for information, and complete daily tasks through a simple, conversational interface.

    Start the Discovery Center Mission to establish a unified Joule instance, and explore setup guides that include Joule in SAP SuccessFactors to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public and Private Edition to Analytical Insights in Joule.

    For those looking to level up and build on the capabilities of Joule Base, there are Joule Premium packages that integrate premium AI use cases, agents, and analytical skills. Premium AI features are licensed separately under the Premium AI commercial model.

  3. Are there any trials?
    Start your 30-day basic trial of generative AI hub and explore AI‚Äôs full potential with access to the broadest set of models. Learn how to build custom AI solutions or extend your existing SAP applications while maintaining full control over your AI lifecycle.

If you want to dive deeper into the content, rewatch the sessions and access the session material via SAP Learning Hub (subscription required):

  • Deep Dive into Joule Skills (recording)
  • Speed up the everyday work of ABAP developers (recording)
  • Step-by-step guidance to extend Joule via Joule Studio in SAP Build (recording)

Also worth mentioning are the 14 new Joule agents unveiled at SAP Connect, from streamlining Supply Chain Management, automating Customer Experience and Finance, enhancing Human Resource processes, to managing Business Transformation. 

If you‚Äôre eager to find out how to accelerate your journey to enterprise-wide productivity, here are concrete next steps to get started:

  1. Partner with SAP to begin activating Joule Agents
  • We have multiple Joule Agents generally available and in early adopter care, ready for you to activate in your business
  • View available agents here
  1. Connect further with SAP through a business case review, executive workshop, or Joule Agent readiness assessment.
  2. Check out this Learning Journey to understand how to use Joule agents to enhance decision-making, automate workflows, and integrate AI.

Speaking of developer tools! While it is a wrap for this year‚Äôs Octoberfest in Munich, Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd is in full swing! üçªFrom September 29 to October 24, 2025, Devtoberfest is your warm-up for SAP TechEd. Think of it as a multi-week, virtual developer conference where you can learn at your own pace and connect with the global SAP developer community.

Check out the session catalogue and join hands-on workshops featuring the latest SAP developer tools, AI innovations, and data services to level up your skills in emerging tech. Whether you‚Äôre coding, experimenting, or just exploring what‚Äôs next ahead of SAP TechEd, celebrate Devtoberfest with us!

Hi Joule, what are the latest learning resources I should consume? *

Aside from live enablement sessions, explore our latest on-demand learning resource:

  • Joule End User Enablement: Get a comprehensive overview of Joule from a user‚Äôs perspective. Understand how and when to use it and get started with a quick-start handbook filled with effective Joule prompts.

* Powered by the machine learning technology of SAP AI Business Services, personalized recommendations are generated to employees, in one place on the Learning home page, based on employees' data.

As we look ahead to October, we‚Äôre excited to share with you a new lineup of learning opportunities, designed to help you expand your knowledge and make AI an advantage in your role:

  • October 15, 4 pm CET: Embedded AI in Action: Top Use Cases You Can Activate Today. See live demos showcasing how Business AI features can drive efficiency and innovation across finance, HR, and procurement. Take away concrete activation steps, adoption tips, and get your questions answered.
  • October 15, 5 PM CET: SAP Joule for Consultants Expert Session: Unlock efficient project delivery with Joule. This webinar provides an overview of SAP Joule for Consultants, an AI-powered assistant tailored to enhance consultants' productivity and problem-solving capabilities, whether in consulting or client organizations.
  • October 22, 10 am CET: From Activation to Application: Getting Started with SAP Joule for Consultants. Understand the technical steps required to get started and gain actionable insights to use the product effectively. See a live demo showcasing how SAP Joule for Consultants can drive productivity.
  • November 4, 5 PM CET: Discover Joule: Realize the potential of AI with faster, seamless workflows across your SAP applications

 Stay tuned for more, and happy learning! üöÄ

#Joule #Joule Agents #AI Foundation #Joule Studio #SAP Business AI #AI Enablement #AI skill

Just to complement Luca‚Äôs approach. To assign different validation methods to different consolidation versions it will be necessary to create a Data Entry Special Version and assign it to your Extension Version

entry.title: Compensation-Combined Statement tokens for position effective date
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

My client requested the following requirement for the statement:
In the case of a promotion, a condition text appears. In that section, they want the effective date of the new position and the new position title to be displayed.
To retrieve the position title, we used the token [[$TITLE]], which works fine.
However, we can't find a similar way to retrieve the effective date.
Does anyone know anything about this and could guide me?
From the investigation we've done, we haven't found anything that brings in the position effective date.

Thank you in advance,

Olga

entry.title: Re: Specified network layer is invalid : SQLite when usin...
entry.content:
The issue lies in the fact that you're trying to work with a universe that uses a connection type no longer supported by the SDK‚Äîspecifically, SQLite.

Try opening a different universe that connects to a supported database (such as Oracle, ....) and see if the error persists.

......
Hope this helps!

entry.title: Fixed Point in Time Effective Date - Basis Calculation
entry.content:
Hi @xavierlegarrec 

We are using Fixed point in time option to calculate the Target Amount (Basis). However, the results are unexpected.

Two queries:

1. In Employee History, while directly updating the data (specifically salary and target %), the Basis is not getting updated. Is this the expected behaviour? Can a comp admin for few employees not directly update the Target % or Salary directly in EH?

2. When EH is imported from EC, for one record Target % is showing as 0 in EH. However, the Basis is appearing same as Salary. My expectation was that Target Amount (Basis) should have been 0 in this case.

Look forward to your expertise on these.

entry.title: Re: Crystal reports + zebra cut options
entry.content: There are a couple of potential solutions but please explain the following sentence:

entry.title: Re: MB5B - DIfference in the Storage Location stock and V...
entry.content:
Based on your post, the specific issue is movement type 641 (used for stock transfer to subcontractor) is valuated but does not require a storage location. When posted without LGORT (storage location), it updates valuated stock at the plant level. It does NOT update storage location or batch stock, hence MB5B storage location view misses it.

The recommended actions would be

  • Use SE16N or MB51 to list all 641 documents for material LNG in plant 1200. Check if LGORT is blank in MSEG.
  • Review the subcontracting PO setup and ensure storage location is defaulted or manually entered. Consider a validation or enhancement to prevent 641 postings without LGORT. For that, you can explore BAdI MB_DOCUMENT_BADI or enhancement MBCF0002.
  • For plant 1200, reconcile MB5B valuated stock with storage location stock by extracting 641 documents without LGORT. Manually adjusting or reporting the delta.
